This would be difficult to implement - suddenly increasing the tick speed every time you sleep would hurt some people's computer performance - and it also would be immensely exploited to get tons of smelting done instantly. I like your desire for realism, but I don't think it would work here.
Maybe what the developers could do is have the furnace smelt a extra 8 items or so in the time you sleep, and the tick performance shouldn‚Äôt be affected because everyone has to be in a bed

Maybe what could be done is that the devoplers examine how many iron/gold is smelted from when people can ‚Äúsleep‚Äù(aka sunset) to the daybreak of the game, then code it so when you sleep, that many items is Auto smelted but it only works at night or if there is a mod that lets you sleep anytime of the day

Time could just be a mechanic, and the game could improve memorizing states and constantly be tracking things such as number and state of all blocks/objects in a world, block placement, world states, seasons, death time and location, and player/other inventories over the course of in game time. Exact date could be represented as a coordinate.

I wouldn't expect much, especially at first because of system requirements. I imagine it would be impossible to memorize exact player or mob movements, for example. Maybe it could be done to an extent though.

This would mostly be an opportunity to have the game automatically save more/introduce the ability to travel further forwards or backwards in time. You can already skip (aka time travel) to the next morning by sleeping in a bed at the beginning of night, so if commands were input via creative menus, or an exact date input into a time machine* (see time machine item post) the player(s) would get a chance to go to a previous, current, or future time and date, but at current coordinates. Since you can't turn off the autosave feature anymore, if you die and lose an item, it's gone. A good way to think about this is like a new coordinate; a new category of location. It'd enable one to farm crops/resources that aren't currently ready for harvest, revisit past destroyed structures, bring back deceased companions as long as they were named with a nametag, and undo undesired actions (going afk to have your house be blown up by a creeper.)

It seems like its main purpose is for the making of fireworks, the kind that explode and make pretty colors, not the kind you use to fly.

Me?  I guess I left out a step, but fire charges are made into firework stars, which make the fancy type fireworks.

What if it acted as a temporary fire aspect?
You would craft your sword or axe with a fire charge, you would get a 5 minute enchantment for fire aspect.

This is a great idea, as fire charges are useless when compared to flint and steel. They should be throwable, with a cooldown like the enderpearl

Maybe fire charges could be used inside of the firework recipe (not the firework star recipe) to increase damage? Fireworks as ammunition in crossbows does not make crossbows an alternative to a decked out, power V bow. This could change that (of course not making it too overpowered). It would make firework ammunition worth gaining and using.

Here's how I think throwing Fire Charges should work:

- They have the same cooldown as the snowballs in the combat snapshots

- Same range as a snowball

- They should also set blocks on fire, activate portals, campfires, and ignite TNT

The code for Single Biome world is inside of Bedrock Edition, but there is no UI to create one. They can only be accessed by editing a world's code or via a third-party site.

There are also a few quirks:

  • Mineshafts and Strongholds generate in every biome
  • Single Biome affects the End but not The Nether
  • Any Non-land biome does not generate their terrain
  • Oceans and rivers, when inside of a Nether dimension have a checkerboard-like pattern of water and lava
  • Structure generation cuts off at y-level 256 when in a nether or end biome

It‚Äôs not widely known or fully developed, but can still be accessed using third party tools (such as NBTStudio)

yes please. i despise how fire spread works in this game. it leaves entirely unburnt blocks just floating in the air and everything about is so ugly. making the blocks actually burn to ash and fall would be much nicer

Perhaps instead of going straight to cinders we could first get charred wood in order to better provide a realistic fire spread in the sense at least of not leaving so many floating blocks?

We really should find a use for the ash if we want this to have a substantial chance of being implemented. The first clear use I could find for ash is in compost though due to the salt content too much could hurt the plants. Second clear use is to remove stains or in this case for specifically remove dyes.

The third and best use is to refine it for the salt content which would give it a good niche if salt is added to the game and proves useful. Based on wood ash composition after salt is extracted the result would be roughly equivalent to bone meal. I will now eventually write a suggestion asking for salt to be added to the game, thank you for the inspiration.

This sounds crazy at first, but you know what, I'd actually like to see this. It's no more ridiculous than using fireworks to boost you while gliding in the air. It doesn't seem unbalanced either: it would be cheaper than powered rails, but you couldn't AFK travel with it.

So yes for minecarts, and maybe for boats. Fireworks and boats just sound odd to me, not sure why.

Yeahhh and then you can bring back the BOAT BREAKING element if you firework rocket your boat into the shore.
I also want a FIREWORK MINECART that can be activated by the activator rails.  GO!

This is a neat idea.  However, I don't think it's vital.  But it would be a nice way to protect a very special tool.

I would almost think it would be better as a treasure enchantment.  Something extra special, like mending.

I disagree with this idea. I was under the impression that the elytra has this feature because it is uncraftable.... isn't Mending powerful enough already to prevent your favorite tools from breaking?
This would be a neat idea. Should be as rare as Mending though.

It's a nice idea, however a little op. Perhaps if:

1. Was incompatible with unbreaking and/or mending

2. Was a treasure enchant so it's harder to get

3. While it will save the item from breaking and will prevent players from using it, players should be unable to use it until it is fully repaired
Personally I think this feature should just straight up be added to Unbreaking as a bonus. The only "challenge" it removes is looking at your tools every so often to see if they are about to break.
This should replace Mending. Mending makes crafting tools almost obsolete for me, because I rarely lose equipment if ever.

This is what "Unbreaking" should have been. The current enchantment is more of a "Can still break but lasts longer" enchantment, which could be called simply Toughness, which is not much of a magical thing to begin with. I imagine true Unbreakable to be some kind of upgrade to the current Unbreaking, a mutual exclusive thing.

I was thinking of this as well, it'd be really nice for when you have an item that is for whatever reason special to you, and you don't want it to ever break.

In addition to this though, I think Mending should be nerfed. With how it currently works, if something has Mending on it, it's basically unbreakable. I feel like Mending should be based more on making repairing in an anvil better (which I think would also require a change to how XP costs in Anvils work)

I don't think a broken item with this Enchantment should be unusable necessarily (with some exceptions, like the bow and shield), but rather make them basically functionless until you repair them. (so you could still mine with a broken pickaxe, but it'd be really slow, and wouldn't drop blocks, and you could attack with a broken sword, but it'd be slower and less efficient than punching)

I agree that this should be an enchantment. The only issue I see with it is the fact that the enchantment is extremely helpful with mending, but almost useless without it. Imagine a new player stumbling across an unbreakable shovel. They use it till it‚Äôs out a durability and are confused why it just stops working. Even when they figure it out they don‚Äôt have mending. There is no real reason to repare the shovel with an anvil as it‚Äôs cheaper to craft a new one and there are no other enchantments on it. The obvious answer to this is don‚Äôt let newcomers in early game get this enchantment. You should only get the enchantment when you have access to mending. Therefore, it should be rarer then mending. Maybe end city only or something like that.


An option to consider:

If it is deemed too op then consider making it mutually exclusive with unbreaking. Then the player will have a trade off between a tool that won‚Äôt last as long but will stop working when durability is 1, and one that will last longer but they have to pay attention to the red bar to make sure it isn‚Äôt lost forever.
Maybe there should be a way for the tool to get that enchantment if you combine that tool with a totem of undying in an anvil.

I could see more bug/particles and decor (like the fungus on birch) to give more life to biomes, but I doubt they will add tons of new mobs, hopefully, they will add onto variants of the classic mobs though, sheep with horns in cold biomes, fluffier sheep in meadows, etc. Chickens of biome-specific colors, or more variations, cows with more variant colors as well could do a lot without adding more.
Still, I hope that they will add more lively and realistic animals to the game. Perhaps just some basic wildlife and some variations, but I still think this would be great.

Hello. I wanted to present a Mob idea for the new wild update. Just a thought, Alligators would be awesome to see. With 1 or 2 popping up randomly. Was thinking they could be a hostile mob that attacks the frogs and also your player, but only spawn in the Mangrove swamp. Like how the Wolves attack sheep for example. When the Alligator dies, they could drop an Alligator tooth which could also be used to make arrows, similar to the feather. On a side note, as a player I also would love to see some more use for the copper ores and blocks besides a lightning Rod and a Monocle. Most of the time I just end up bypassing the ore inside a cave because I hardly have any need for it's use. It's a cool material for sure, but doing more with it would be awesome! Just an idea, I was thinking it would be cool to build a wand out of the copper that you could use to shoot different elemental shots at Mobs, like small fire balls or ice shards. The ingredients could be 1 lightning Rod, 1 ender perl, and 2 ingots of choice for it's durability and power. The enchament you give your Rod would determine the kind of Wand it is, being fire burst, or ice balls, etc.
